20M U.K. iPhone, iPad users could get compensation in £1.5B lawsuit

stories.text: I have deep interest in many different things, and have spent enough time with stuff like programming, painting, jazz piano, writing to find that I equally love them all and could easily spend a lifetime focusing deeply on each one. But life is short and it is not possible to commit to all of them and test my limits in each area, so I really need to do better and find a way to focus. I just don't know how to do so. Anyone else been through this?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to decide which of your many interests to spend time on?

stories.text: New CS grad (bachelors). Looking for advice on how to make myself more marketable/employable for a first job. I have some projects on my resume to talk about and I have no desire to study/practice Leetcode/DSA problems because I would rather learn a new skill, refine existing ones, or build something from a tutorial/course/idea. Not sure what to do since I know most new grad interviews focus on some copy pasted problems from Leetcode instead of talking about skills from previous projects, but I'd rather build something.
stories.title: Ask HN: Focus on data structures/algos or projects to build skills
